Detailed Description : .Hidden Markov Models ( HMMs ) are widely used as a probabilistic inference tool for applications generating temporal or spatial sequential data .Relative simplicity of implementation , combined with their ability to discover latent domain knowledge have made them very popular in diverse fields such as DNA sequence alignment , gene discovery , handwriting analysis , voice recognition , computer vision , language translation and parts - of - speech tagging .

A HMM is defined as a tuple ( S , O , Theta ) where S is a finite set of unobservable , hidden states emitting symbols from a finite observable vocabulary set O according to a probabilistic model Theta .The parameters of the model Theta are defined by the tuple ( A , B , Pi ) where A is a stochastic transition matrix of the hidden states of size S X S. The elements pi_(s ) of the S length vector Pi determine the probability that the system starts in the hidden state s. The transitions of hidden states are unobservable and follow the Markov property of memorylessness .
